title: How to Set Up Your DirecTV (Genie RC73) Remote Control

steps.title: Make sure that your Genie receiver is plugged in.
steps.content: Make sure that your Genie receiver is plugged in. In order for you to program your Genie remote, your Genie receiver must be plugged into your TV and a power source, and the receiver must be powered on. Possible models of the Genie receiver include the Genie HD DVR, Genie Mini, and Wireless Genie Mini.

steps.title: Ensure that you're using your Genie remote.
steps.content: Ensure that you're using your Genie remote. Genie remotes can have any one of the following model numbers: RC-73, RC-72, RC-71B, or RC-71. You should see the appropriate model number in the upper-left side of your remote. If you're using a non-Genie remote, you can't program it for use with your Genie receiver.

steps.title: Turn on your TV.
steps.content: Turn on your TV. If your TV isn't set to use the Genie receiver as its input, you'll also need to switch to the Genie receiver's input channel by pressing the Video or Input button before proceeding.

steps.title: Point your Genie remote at its receiver.
steps.content: Point your Genie remote at its receiver. You should have a direct line of sight from your remote to your Genie receiver.

steps.title: Press and hold the MUTE and ENTER buttons.
steps.content: Press and hold the MUTE and ENTER buttons. Doing so will prompt your Genie remote to begin connecting to the receiver.

steps.title: Release the buttons when prompted.
steps.content: Release the buttons when prompted. When you see the green lights flash on the remote flash twice, you can release the buttons. [1] X Research source If you don't see the flash or you are otherwise unable to program your DIRECTV Genie remote for use with your TV, try using the manual setup instead.

steps.title: Wait for the confirmation message.
steps.content: Wait for the confirmation message. You should see "Your remote is now setup for RF" appear on-screen when the remote's setup is complete. You may have to exit this menu by pressing the SELECT button.

steps.title: Turn on the component that you want to program if necessary.
steps.content: Turn on the component that you want to program if necessary. If you're attempting to program your Genie remote for an audio source, for example, you'll want to make sure that the audio source is plugged in and turned on.

steps.title: Press the MENU button.
steps.content: Press the MENU button. It's on your remote. Doing so opens the on-screen menu.

steps.title: Select Settings & Help.
steps.content: Select Settings & Help . Use the arrows on your remote to select this option, then press ENTER .

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . This option is in the menu. The Settings menu will open.

steps.title: Select Remote Control.
steps.content: Select Remote Control . You'll find this option in the settings menu.

steps.title: Select Program Remote.
steps.content: Select Program Remote . It's in the Remote Control menu. Doing so brings up a list of items for which you can program your Genie remote.

steps.title: Select a component to set up.
steps.content: Select a component to set up. Select either Program a TV or Program an Audio Device in the menu. The menu options that you see here may vary slightly.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions. Your Genie receiver will display the instructions for programming your remote for your selected component. Once you complete these instructions, your remote should work with your selected item. If programming your Genie remote for your TV, you'll select a manufacturer and a television model before you can set up your remote.

steps.title: Press and hold the MUTE and SELECT buttons.
steps.content: Press and hold the MUTE and SELECT buttons. You'll need to hold down these buttons until otherwise instructed.

steps.title: Release the buttons when you see the remote's light blink twice.
steps.content: Release the buttons when you see the remote's light blink twice. This light is at the top of the remote. Doing so will indicate that your remote can now be used with your Genie receiver.

steps.title: Enter the pairing code.
steps.content: Enter the pairing code. Using your remote, type in 961 , then press channel up and press ENTER .

steps.title: Press OK when prompted.
steps.content: Press OK when prompted. Do so when you see the "Your remote is now set up for RF" message appear on your TV.

steps.title: Find the code for your TV.
steps.content: Find the code for your TV. You can find your TV model's DIRECTV programming code by doing the following: Go to https://www.directv.com/support/article/000092856 in your browser. Click your Genie remote's model number. Click the TV option. Select your TV's manufacturer (e.g., Samsung ). steps.title: Enter your TV's code.
steps.content: Enter your TV's code. Type in the code that you obtained from the website earlier, then press ENTER . The rest of the setup should occur automatically. If you didn't look up your TV's code, common codes include the following: Samsung DirecTV Ready TV - 54000 Sony DirecTV Ready TV - 54001 Toshiba DirecTV Ready TV - 54002
